website_summaries.verdict: A highly rated balance bike that is specifically designed for the youngest riders.
pros: This affordable model can be used as either a tricycle or a two-wheel balance bike
It is manufactured using lightweight ABS material and features a secret storage compartment under the seat
cons: This balance bike is small, if you have a taller or an older child, it is not for you

customer_reviews.title: Cute but Teeny Tiny
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this thing but it is Teeny Tiny. Its probably good for 18 months to about 2.5. We got this for his 2nd birthday and he’s about 27 months (and small for his age) in the picture. He is probably only going to use it for a few more months. But happy we got it because he uses it all the time. There is a tiny little compartment in the seat you could put stuff in but its too hard for little fingers to open so its not really useful for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie O.

customer_reviews.title: Good design. Low build quality.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good design and it’s stable for toddlers, but the built quality is not great. I don’t like how the wheel are wobbly. They don’t feel like they’ll last. I uploaded a video so you can see what I mean. They also sent me a bike with a different design the was in the description and picture. That’s not as big of an issue, but still lame.
customer_reviews.author: 34Michael34

customer_reviews.title: Cute bike, tips easily
customer_reviews.text: Really cute, bought for our daughter’s first birthday. She picked it up quickly (she watches her 4 year old brother ride his bike) and loves scooting around on it. It does tip over quite easily, though. If the back two wheel were just a little farther apart, it would increase stability. She is now nearly 14 months old and has improved her own balance and tips over much less frequently, so with practice, things get better. But I still think more stability would make this a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Maya Lee

customer_reviews.title: WAY too small for a two year old. NOT a trike.
customer_reviews.text: This might have been a good idea if it really opened into a true three wheeled trike. Instead the "change" barely makes any difference at all. Also it's waaay too small for a two year old. (The height is NOT adjustable). (Why are we pushing 2 year olds to ride two wheelers anyway. Trikes are a blast)
customer_reviews.author: Not Sherlock

customer_reviews.title: I am removing 1 star because the flashing in the steering parts should have been cleaned up better. I was able to make it catch
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our 1 year old daughter for her birthday she started walking two months ago. It provides just enough wheel width that she doesn't fall constantly but is narrow enough on the three wheel configuration that she learns to balance. I am removing 1 star because the flashing in the steering parts should have been cleaned up better. I was able to make it catch less by swinging the steering back and forth with some pressure on it for 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: J_A_B

customer_reviews.title: My kid has loved this
customer_reviews.text: My kid has loved this since he was less than a year old. He turned 16 months recently and I just converted it into the '2 wheel' configuration. The seat height goes up when you convert it to two wheels from three. The only downside is that the seat height is only adjustable by converting between two wheels and three. He loves to practice riding. The durability seems just fine if you can keep the bigger kids off of it.
customer_reviews.author: Shellamae & Carl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Starter Balance Bike.
customer_reviews.text: My little guy under two loves this bike and rides it very well. The first step with a bit wider wheel is just enough stability and having to balance for him. He immediately was able to ride and figure out turning for both forward's and backwards. It does work better on smooth surfaces like concrete but he does ride it on our dirt road as well. It is August now and my guy will turn two in October. What a perfect balancing bike start for a little one. I'm glad we invested in this purchase. Balance bikes are such a great idea to get them riding young.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for 1 year old
customer_reviews.text: very light. easy to handle. Says 1-3 year old on the package. I got it for my son when he was 26 months old. He's at 50% for height and weight. It was already too small for him. I would recommend for kids between 12 -24 months.
customer_reviews.author: dc23

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This bike is pretty much worthless unless your child just wants to sit on it and not move much. It’s hard to get it to go on any surface and if they do get going downhill at all, it’s actually dangerous. The two back wheels have no ability to sway with the ride so unless the child is steering and balancing perfectly straight, they fall completely over. The only good thing about it is that it’s very small for very small kids and it’s cute. I actually just took this bike to the dump.
customer_reviews.author: Stina L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: If you have a tall kid, you might want to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this but the "grows with your child" concept isn't truly strictly true. My son is pretty tall two year old - in the 80th percentile currently. The bike is way too small in both positions (two and three wheels). I figured this MAY be the case but that I could mitigate this by making the seat higher, but the seat can only be in the highest position when the bike is in one wheel mode, and only in the lowest position in three wheel mode.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Great first bike ... for a small toddler
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest but tiniest balance bike I've ever seen! My 21 month old son loves it. Great price, delivered on time, and he enjoys using it inside since it's too cold to be outside right now. It is pretty small, so he seems to tower over it a bit, but it doesn't affect the function. He is able to ride without issue; it just looks a little funny. I am not sure he will be able to use it up to his third birthday, simply because it's so small, but he will get plenty of use out of it. I would definitely buy this again and will probably buy some as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Bhizzy

customer_reviews.title: Tips over easily
customer_reviews.text: Bought for one year old. Tips over easily and baby hit her head. The rear wheels need an adjustment to widen the distance between them for beginners
customer_reviews.author: msdelight

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old Loves this
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old loves this bike. We have had it since last September and he still rides it all of the time. It is the perfect height for a small child, easy to set up, has two options for balance, and a cute little storage box. The bike is so easy for him to hop on and ride, he always grabs his hat, and lays his sippy cup in the space below the handle bars (not a feature but it works). I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Walka-walka-walka
customer_reviews.text: It's a terrific product. Stability-wise, little ones that understand the concept of a balance bike will love it. Kids that would be better suited to a tricycle will not like it because it will tip over. Cool design and well made. The seat contains a small storage area for snacks & small toys.
customer_reviews.author: D from Granite Bay CA

customer_reviews.title: Great little balance bike
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth Chillafish Bunzi I have given as a gift and each time it was received without issue and with great satisfaction. Truly a great til in building balance for little kids. My niece went from the bunzi to a balance bike to a bicycle without training wheels by the time she was 4.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Michael

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Baby bike
customer_reviews.text: So small. Unless you have a tiny 3yo.. this is best for first birthday if even that. The bike itself I adorable but it’s tiny!
customer_reviews.author: Redhott69

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could say I liked it.
customer_reviews.text: Very unsatisfied with this bike. Wish I could say it was good. But they broke very easily. Not made for kids 1 to 3yrs. Their legs are too long or the bike is to short. The seat racks. Don't know what happened usually chillafish has a really good products.
customer_reviews.author: Cabrina Briano

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to not get what you ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I definitely ordered a green bike. What I received was a pink and purple bike... So now I don’t have the gift I wanted and if it gets replace it will be too late for the event... so I’m pretty disappointed. In fact, I would give zero stars if that was a possibility.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan and Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: it's a lot of fun for her and great that it can grow with ...
customer_reviews.text: got this for our 1yr old since she's obsessed with our 2yr old strider bike. while she mostly just rides it around the house and occasionally outside (even at the bmx track), it's a lot of fun for her and great that it can grow with her and eventually become a balance bike. have recommended to many friends
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Good bike but keep an eye out.
customer_reviews.text: My kiddo has a lot of fun riding this bike and I'm happy with the purchase! Only thing I want to note is that my little constantly gets her leg stuck in between the handle and seat when trying to get off of it. You can see in my photos I wrapped this area in white duct tape to keep this from happening. Again, great little bike but just be aware of the leg trap!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jennings

customer_reviews.title: It took her a little while to get used to it and feel comfortable. She now zooms everywhere and loves taking her ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter at Christmas. She was only 15 months at the time. It took her a little while to get used to it and feel comfortable. She now zooms everywhere and loves taking her “bike” everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Aussie71421

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for2
customer_reviews.text: Sooo perfect for my 2 year old. She measures on the 50% height and just turned 2 and this is exactly what she needed. She loves the 3 wheel version so far and loves the Freedom to scoot around while her older system balance bikes on a big kid version. Seriously super cute. Could even use inside if you have a long hall or open floor plan!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Not good for tall kids.
customer_reviews.text: It's cute but my very tall 17mo. Old has trouble riding it is the tricicle configuration. I wish the seat height was adjustible. It is not, even thou the description implies it is. The isone height for the tricicle and another for the bicycle config.
customer_reviews.author: Keith McGinley

customer_reviews.title: 2 yr old loves this bike
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old loves this bike, he cruises right along. I was a little worried it'd be tippy with the narrow set of rear wheels but not at all!
customer_reviews.author: The Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: For a small todler
customer_reviews.text: The bike is nicely made and has a cute design. Works really well at home on the flat surface. But outside it is much harder for my toddler to push it. The tires are really thin. I think it is a great pushbike for a child smalec than 2 y old as it is really small.
customer_reviews.author: Edyta Koziel

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My 2 sons love this!! My 4 year old it a bit too big for it. But is great for my 2 year old. We got it for him when he was 18mths.
customer_reviews.author: Disneymama3

customer_reviews.title: This was an awesome purchase for my son
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome purchase for my son. Bought it shortly after he started walking and he's still enjoying it at 2.5 years even though he's a tall boy. Perfect for indoors, backyard or sidewalk. He's easily able to lug it up and down the stairs or over "hurdles". We will now upgrade to a balance bike for him.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 2yo, but 4yo big sister wants it, too!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous bike for my active two-year old. He hasn't let it out of his sight since getting it and can easily zoom around the house or the block, and it's light enough for him to easily pick up or carry. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: I love that even in tricycle mode it teaches balance because ...
customer_reviews.text: I love that even in tricycle mode it teaches balance because the wheels aren’t incredibly spaced out. We practiced inside for a bit and just brought it outside today. He loves it. (19 months old)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good beginner training bike to learn balancing
customer_reviews.text: Very good beginner training bike to learn balancing. Good for between 1 to 3 years old. Then you can upgrade to their next level up. My 2 year old loves this, the 4 year old loves the bigger version with only 2 wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Lee

customer_reviews.title: we love to hide little ping pong balls in it
customer_reviews.text: My little boy loves this bike and he just turned one years old. I was thinking of getting him a strider bike but decided against it since he is still young and wouldn't be able to use it for a while. He already gets on the Chillafish and can go around our living room. He loves the compartment in the seat, we love to hide little ping pong balls in it. When we open it for him, he loves the surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My toddler absolutely loves this thing. I'm giving it ...
customer_reviews.text: My toddler absolutely loves this thing. I'm giving it 4/5 stars because the seat compartment is difficult to open, even for me. After he nearly threw a fit trying--and failing--to get it to open, I distracted him with something else, and he's since forgotten that it's even there. I'd suggest you do the same, unless you get one that's easier to open.
customer_reviews.author: GearInches

customer_reviews.title: Small but perfect for a 1-3 year old
customer_reviews.text: cute and just as everyone else described. Small but perfect for a 1-3 year old. I got my daughter a balance bike and didn't want my 1 1/2 year old son to be left out of the riding fun. I knew he couldn't peddle a tricycle so i found this. He loves the little trunk. The height is not adjustable so make sure you check the size carefully. He is now a tad over 2 and still loves this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a one and a half year old!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been using this bike since sge was 16 months and LOVES it. Always scooting around on it. She is 18 months now and I think we will get at least a few more months out of it before she gets too big for it.
customer_reviews.author: Trish J

customer_reviews.title: Glad we got this before 1 yr old
customer_reviews.text: Wheels are cheap plastic. Wouldn't last long riding on a street or sidewalks. Great in the house on wood or ceramic floors. Great for short stature children who may be in lower percentile height. Because of the adjustable height. Great for new walkers.
customer_reviews.author: ChickenRun

customer_reviews.title: Really good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality product. But it is on a small size. My son is two and way too big for this now :( it was a good start for biking though :)) he has bigger regular balance bike now. He still rides this at home.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Clewner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bicycle for Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this bicycle and roams around the house with ease and really loves it. Have not had any issues with this product so I am giving it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: MKMCHO

customer_reviews.title: Too short for my 1.5 yr old!! Don’t waste your time, no way is the age rage up to 3!
customer_reviews.text: Tiny! My child isn’t even 2 yet and this is so short he can’t push off with his feet because his knees are practically parallel to the ground. Do not buy unless your child is unusually short!
customer_reviews.author: Brown Eyed Girl

customer_reviews.title: Made my son so happy! My 14 month old has been attempting to ...
customer_reviews.text: Made my son so happy! My 14 month old has been attempting to ride the tricycles at school that are clearly built for 2-3 year olds, only to fall over. This bike is light, it comes fully assembled. My kiddo was so excited with package, he immediately began saying "go, go, go". There is a little learning curve on this I am sure but my son doesn't have much fear of falling over and trying again. Word of advice, get your kid a helmet! Bunzi is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Candice Blair (Candice Blair Antonio)

customer_reviews.title: Great bike.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for young toddlers. Great for inside or smooth surfaces outside. Gets a bit bumpy on rough concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Tedford

customer_reviews.title: my 1. 5 year old is a little wobbly ...
customer_reviews.text: my 1.5 year old is a little wobbly on it but it's so close to ground and we only ride so far in house so it's okay if he falls. I'm sure he will get the hang of it soon and he loves that he has his own bike.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my son who is 22 months. He has absolutely loved it. Our friend turned us on to it and within two weeks my nephew and niece got one too. Our babes going around the block on them. We felt the bike had paid for its self just a few weeks after it was purchased. He still loves it and rides it with his cousins. So fun!
customer_reviews.author: Alexzandrea Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly for a 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: A little wobbly with my almost 2 year old son, the “3-wheel” isn’t very stable. I’m disappointed In how cheaply made it feels. Wouldn’t buy again, will be looking for another trike for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Queen sweetie

customer_reviews.title: Little one loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our great niece (1 year old) loves it. Cute design!
customer_reviews.author: Tigerpaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves her new bike.. thank you chillafish for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Talley

customer_reviews.title: Great 1st Birthday Present
customer_reviews.text: This red "trike" is adorable for my granddaughter's first birthday, which I plan to pair with a cute red helmet ! Very easy to assemble too!
customer_reviews.author: Texas Katie

customer_reviews.title: This is ok, but I wish there were a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is ok, but I wish there were a way to adjust it and make the seat taller as my child has grown.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are built very well and the kids love them. We will be buying more as the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we have purchased for our second grandson. They are built very well and the kids love them. We will be buying more as the family grows.
customer_reviews.author: SoutheasternPA

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Gem
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 16 months and 31” tall, she took to it rather quickly. It’s super lightweight, yet sturdy enough that my wife was able to take it for a quick spin.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Cute. Bought for 1 yr old....shes tiny but she will grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: Rsladay

customer_reviews.title: This bike is great. I wish a slightly bigger one was available
customer_reviews.text: This bike is great. I wish a slightly bigger one was available. Our nephew is getting better at riding this, and probably should have a regular tricycle but gets frustrated with pedals. This bike, if a little small for him (he turned two but is a little short) has been helping him get comfortable moving himself around.
customer_reviews.author: allison edwards

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to convert to a two-wheel bike as well
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this bike! We gave it to him for his two-year birthday. It was already assembled (BIG plus). It's lightweight so you can take it anywhere. It's easy to convert to a two-wheel bike as well. We ride it indoors and outdoors. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I'm worried he will grow too tall for it before long. He's tall for his age (85th percentile). It is possible he won't grow out of it too soon. But I'm not sure.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Cranford Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Works great for us but our kids have short legs.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone asks us about this and my 18 month old LOVES it. It is a perfect great size for her (she is about 2 feet 6 inches tall), but she has short legs. A friend of ours has a two year old who still liked it a lot but she was taller and it seemed like she would probably be too big for it before she was ready to have it go into balance bike mode. With that being said, even my 3 year old tries to ride it and still likes it even though she is WAY too big for it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: This little bike is perfect for my 2 1/2 year old son
customer_reviews.text: This little bike is perfect for my 2 1/2 year old son. He is on the small side at only 26lbs and this bike fits him perfectly. It may be a little small for a larger child.
customer_reviews.author: T. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great for developing toddler balance and core!
customer_reviews.text: My 26 mo old loves this bike. She is small for her age (1st percentile, 20 pounds), but I can see her using this bike for a long time. I love that she has to balance on it, strengthening her core and balance more than regular tricycles would. We are still using the 3 wheel setting.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST bike!!! My grandson started using it when he was about 20 months old....with three wheels. He LOVES it!!! Doesn't scratch hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Falls over easily. Our grandson is tall for his age. Might work for later, but he kept falling over.
customer_reviews.author: buren lee furr jr

customer_reviews.title: What a great product. I purchased it for my grandsons 1st ...
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. I purchased it for my grandsons 1st birthday. He cannot ride it forward yet but he sits on it and pushes himself backwards and is able to begin practicing balancing on it. Overall, it is a great beginner product.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: The plastic portion around the screw holding the seat on and bike together is cracked. Just received this, arrived late and can't safely use it
customer_reviews.author: Ac

customer_reviews.title: This was a really good toy👍🏻 Helps the little guys balance and get around
customer_reviews.text: This was a really good toy👍🏻 Helps the little guys balance and get around.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

customer_reviews.title: It took him a good 6 months to warm up to this but once ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. It took him a good 6 months to warm up to this but once spring came we couldn't get it off of it. I've had to trick him and switch it to the 2 wheel mode when he's sleeping otherwise he flips it over, tries to unscrew it, and put it back to the 3 wheel mode.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Damaged on Receipt
customer_reviews.text: Left handle bar had a major crack. It was only protected by a thin piece of foam. The handle bars and front wheel were outside the primary product box.
customer_reviews.author: G. David Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old loved this! He is now 2 and rides it around the neighborhood! Great for little legs!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: My 16 month grandson uses it in the three wheel ...
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month grandson uses it in the three wheel arrangement and likes it. My son put it in the two wheel balance bike mode and said that will add to its longevity and interest. The right size for a very early beginner. So ---- there is room to grow!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great for little kids!
customer_reviews.text: Very manageable for small kids, probably kids 2 and younger. We really love it but wish we could get another year out of it, just a little too small
customer_reviews.author: nieljo4

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my 20 month old. My kiddo truly ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my 20 month old. My kiddo truly loves this bike. I can definitely see the improvement in balance over time. We are still in tricycle mode but soon we will be switching to bicycle mode. The rubber wheels are also a plus because they protect our hardwood flooring from scratches.
customer_reviews.author: M Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an active 2yr old!
customer_reviews.text: This bike has been awesome for my 2yr old son! He rides it all around the house and has really gained balance and increased speed as he becomes more comfortable on it! It’s the perfect size for him and keeps him busy! It’s very durable! We love it! So glad a friend recommended it for my active little 2yr old!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Harvey

customer_reviews.title: probably perfect for most kids
customer_reviews.text: probably perfect for most kids. However my daughter is in the 99th percentile and it was simply too short for her. she loved it till we bought one for "older kids" that fit her long legs better
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this might be too big or hard for my 18 month old to get on. He LOVES it and doesn't have any problems getting on or maneuvering on it. Its great!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Simeone

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bike
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect first bike for my toddler. He figured it out quickly and zooms all over the house. It was easy to assemble and looks well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Alligood

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: my 2 year old got this for Christmas and rides on it all the time. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ALove1979

customer_reviews.title: Missing part so it tips
customer_reviews.text: Just figured out that there is a missing part. So it tips over. The spread bar for the back wheels is missing.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Lasusa

customer_reviews.title: Our grandson got along well with this little bike and ...
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson got along well with this little bike and it will work later on when he gets ready for a single rear wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Amateur Welder

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Toy for Toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: This bike is just amazing. We gave this to our daughter on second birthday. I think it would have been better to get it for her earlier because she's really tall and it makes it a little less easy for her to keep her feet up as she's balancing. She loves it though, and it's really easy for her to maneuver and scoot about. It's even light enough for her to tote around and has a tiny storage compartment where she can keep a few items. Great for indoor play, great for outdoor play. It's very versatile as a two- or three-wheel bike, lightweight and just a brilliant toy for toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: TexanHippie

customer_reviews.title: Like the concept, but it sucks. Does not promote learning.
customer_reviews.text: Tiny, uncomfortable seat, unsuitable for learning to ride unless your kid is exactly a certain size at the right age since not adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Very small. Good for 1-3 years
customer_reviews.text: Love the small frame on this balance bike. Perfect for little ones up to about 3.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Bullard

customer_reviews.title: Great present for grandparents to give
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews saying they wished they had purchased this bike earlier. Bought it for a one year old who learned within two weeks to zoom everywhere. Great present for grandparents to give.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Safety
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loves this bike. Parks it right next to his bed
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. My toddler loves it
customer_reviews.text: Love the style and functionality of this balance bike. My son loves it. We have not used the balance function yet, but we look forward to it!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: I thought this was very cute and I hope my ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was very cute and I hope my granddaughter will get the use out of it that i planned for. Other than that, I can't really rate it because I have not seen it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori4star

customer_reviews.title: Very cool balance bike
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old LOVES this bike. He's about 33 inches and it is perfect for him. Smaller than a typical balance bike, but he'll still get plenty of experience with it. He uses it inside and outside. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Joslerich

customer_reviews.title: Superior Product!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had this bike when I was two years old. My son loves to race around the house and in our driveway on this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Yoakum

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning
customer_reviews.text: My one yr old grandaughter seems to be getting the hang of it.Great for learning balance
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids that are small enough to ride it are too ...
customer_reviews.text: Kids that are small enough to ride it are too young to learn to balance, and kids that are ready to learn how to balance are too big for it.
customer_reviews.author: Keyser Soze

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great bike for my son to start learning on. In 5 months he is ready for a bigger balance bike. I must have for a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: It was too small. We ended up sending it ...
customer_reviews.text: It was too small. We ended up sending it back for something larger. We were ordering this for my 2 year old granddaughter and it was just too little.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted for my granddaughter and she lives it!
customer_reviews.author: Carmena645

customer_reviews.title: seems more like a plastic toy than a bike
customer_reviews.text: Not what we expected, seems more like a plastic toy than a bike, but it’s cool how it changes if your looking for that feature....I was looking for something more similar to a real bike
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Sized for 12-20 mo, but really great bike!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike! However, it really is tiny. It fit my son from about 12 mo to 20 then we transitioned him to a real glide bike. But he already knew how to balance at that point and now rides like a pro at 24 months. He loves to hide things in the seat. And flipping the bike around from 2 wheels to 3 takes under 2 minutes. Easy to travel w or take camping due to its tiny size. Really great bike for the little one that wants to be like big bro or big sis!
customer_reviews.author: Boymomof3

customer_reviews.title: too small for a 2 year old
customer_reviews.text: it was way to small and now stupid amazon won't let us return it.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Mazurek

customer_reviews.title: Great little bike. Kids will love them.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bikes for my twins and they absolutely love them. It's a great entry bike for your little ones. My little guys started riding them at 1 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha L.

customer_reviews.title: My son likes this BUT it is SMALL. Bought ...
customer_reviews.text: My son likes this BUT it is SMALL. Bought it for his 2nd Birthday and he is too big for it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Voisard

customer_reviews.title: Best starter bike for 1-2 years old
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves this bike. It has been a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: christina

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for the grandkid
customer_reviews.text: My daughter asked for this for my grandaughter's first birthday. So being a good grandma I got it. It was delivered there on time for the big day and my daughter says the kid loves it. I like the fact that it converts from three to two wheels as they grow and get more advanced. So far she's lovin it and that makes me happy. Haven't heard any complaints so I'm taking that to mean no problems at all. So for the little one on the go this seems to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: maggs

customer_reviews.title: Check your child's height
customer_reviews.text: It super fun for all children, but check your child's height first.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Both my boys 3 & 1 1/2 LOVE this bike
customer_reviews.text: Both my boys 3 & 1 1/2 LOVE this bike. They play on it every day every night, Even my 12 year old daughter will ride on it and they chase her around.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: 18 mo old loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 12 mo old for his birthday and it was too soon. It sat in the corner, unused, until he was about 15 months. Now, at 18 months he can't get enough of it! He likes to ride it backwards and through our legs (used as tunnels). It is helping his large motor ability. Although buying it for his birthday was a little soon, it was nice to have available for when he showed interest.
customer_reviews.author: Tanarri

customer_reviews.title: Meh, could have gotten more fun out of a toddler tricycle.
customer_reviews.text: Cute toy, but not a toddler balance bike like i was looking for. Too light to have any stability for riding over bumps and learning balance to ride a bike.
customer_reviews.author: Gleborah

customer_reviews.title: My Son loves this!
customer_reviews.text: He is 2.5 years old however not only does he love it but pretty much all of the 2-4 year olds that come over want to claim this and play with this (yes it does cause some arguing, but the point is, the kids love it) It definitely helps build coordination and balance as well as confidence!
customer_reviews.author: Hendry V.

customer_reviews.title: Great little balance bike but smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Great little balance bike but smaller than I expected, bought for my 2 yr old grandson & he won't be using it for long
customer_reviews.author: Mary J Mendez

product_meta.title: Chillafish Bunzi 2-in-1 Toddler Balance Bike and Tricycle, Ages 1 to 3 Years Old, Adjustable Lightweight First Gradual Balance Bike with Silent Non-Marking Wheels, Lime, One Size
product_meta.description: Color:White / LimeThe Chill fish Bunzl 2-in-1 gradual balance bike and tricycle is uniquely designed to help teach your child balance at their own pace in a fun way. Made from high-quality ABS material, the frame can switch between a 3-wheel mode to a 2-wheel mode in just a few seconds; No tools required. Silent, Non-marking and anti-skid TPE synthetic rubber tires on the Chill fish Bunzl were chosen with you And your house in mind and are equally capable for outdoor treks. As your child grows into the 2-wheel mode the seat also grows with them, moving higher up on the bike to better support their new skills. Lightweight and easy to carry thanks to a handgrip built into the back of the seat you can bring the Bunzl on all your child's trips and adventures. A hidden storage box in the seat so your child can bring along a toy or snacks for the ride! With cute bunny-style handle bars, an intuitive form that grows with them and vibrant colors to display their personality The Chill fish Bunzl is sure to become the preferred bike buddy for your kids; Recommended for ages 1-3, maximum weight 55 lbs.
feature_bullets: LIGHTWEIGHT AND EASY TO CARRY: thanks to a handgrip built into the back of the seat you can bring the Bunzi on all your child's trips and adventures
HIDDEN STORAGE BOX in the seat to bring along a toy or a snack for the ride
Made from high-quality ABS material to play longer

2-in1 GRADUAL BALANCE BIKE FOR KIDS of 1-3 YEARS: when your child is ready to balance on 3 wheels, you can switch toolless to the 2-wheel mode. It's the best way to teach your child balance at his own pace
EASILY ADJUSTABLE SEAT: the seat grows with your child (8.7 inch / 22 cm in 3-wheel mode to 9.8 inch / 25 cm in 2-wheel mode) to better support the new skills of your child
SILENT: non-marking and anti-skid TPE synthetic rubber tires for both indoor and outdoor pleasure
This is a Chillafish product, a young and innovative company specialized in balance bikes and all sorts of wheeled toys. We are determined to bring the Chillafish values to the wide world
